job_title: Direct Support Professional in Ellensburg, WA
pros: I have been working for K.I.M for a short time and have quickly noticed how important my job is.  The company has flexible hours, opportunity for overtime and growth. Great benefits package for full time employees.
cons: It takes good time management, organization, and communication skills.

job_title: Direct Support Professional (DSP) in Ellensburg, WA
pros: You can make decent money in a short amount of time
cons: Stuck on shift in certain homes for DAYS at a time with no relief, they promise it gets better -- never did.

pros:
- Chance to have 40+ hour weeks only at part-time.
- Easy to promote if you are a diligent and hard worker.
- Gain experience in empathy, situational awareness, teamwork, activity planning, budgeting, safety, and more.
- Can gain some certifications.
- Overtime is granted easily if needed.
cons:
- If no one can find another to take your shift, they can and will be made to you work over 8+ hours. Rare instance: This can go up to 24+ hours too.
- Can feel as if there is more care for clients than employees.
- Clients can be more than the average person can have patience for or take care of properly; please be wary of your emotional and mental limitations.
- Retention is small because of the main location in a college town.
- Only minimum wage for a lot of stress and pressure.

job_title: Direct Support Professional in Ellensburg, WA
pros: This company is a joke. I guess a pro is you’ll get a laugh out of thinking this is a good place to work.
cons: Upper management regularly work while intoxicated, people frequently use drugs on the job, nobody cares. People will regularly flake out on their shifts and management will screen your calls leaving you on a 27 hour shift when you only meant to cover an 8 hour night shift. Check Snapchat and they’re out in the bars instead of coming in to make sure you get some sleep for the first time in 2 days. Will manipulate you to come in for an evening shift after you’ve been working for 18 hours and only get 3 hours off in between shifts. Made 100 hour weeks just to be screamed at for forgetting to sign my time sheet once. Get screwed, KIM. You’re awful. Wouldn’t trust you with a pet rock.

review_title: Goes the Extra Mile for Client Services
pros: Professionalism in training and client relations, really make the staff want to be part of making each client's life full of happiness and health.  The clients all are clean and their health is tracked very closely.  Staff are trained in every way to make an effective, positive team!  I have worked here for a bit over a year and used to work for another agency and the quality of care here is far superior to my old work.  Upper management are positive and helpful, even in the face of a challenge, and you can tell that they want each team member to succeed.  Team work is encouraged and staff are rewarded for their efforts.  The pay is more than fair as well.
cons: Still need more staff willing to cover hours for others, but it is being worked on.

review_title: The work is important the staff are awful
pros:
1. you are helping individuals that really become a good part of your life
2. pay raises, easy to work up into the company
3. many different shifts to choose from
4. training is paid for
cons:
1. The upper management need to really take a class about accountability and how to professionally interact with others. 
2. Some clients are treated way better than others and that all depends on who his managing the house hold, if there is a bad house manager the client suffers because upper management either doesn't take action or takes too long to take action
3. there are always staffing issues, staff have even got stuck on shift for over 24 hours without any assistance to put new staff in the house

pros: I find this job has really given me perspective and really caused me to want to be a better person.  Every day isn't great,  and there have been days where I fantasized about working at McDonald's, but once I pushed through those I found that this is the most rewarding and meaningful job I've ever worked.  If you have a big heart,  this is the job for you.
cons: the clients can be irrational at times.

review_title: Best company I have ever worked for
job_title: Talent Acquisition Manager in Ellensburg, WA
pros: I love the team dynamic and the atmosphere of the office. Wouldn't want to spend 40 hours a week anywhere else.
